courseDescription.description: The aim of this module is to provide a strong set of principles and techniques for structuring and representing requirements and architectures.

aim.description: The aim of this module is to provide a strong set of principles and techniques for structuring and representing requirements and architectures.

learningOutcomes.learningOutcome: Describe the role of requirements engineering and architecture design and assessment for the development of critical systems
Describe and participate in techniques for requirements elicitation, representation validation, re-use and traceability
Select and apply architectural strategies to address requirements
Assess the selection and application of architectural strategies
Apply appropriate notations for architecture representation
Discuss the state of the art and future directions in architecture modelling

workload.description: The teaching for this module combines traditional lectures with a number of exercises and case studies which will be tackled in small groups with a lecturer leading each group.

feedback.feedbackDescription: Individual written feedback is provided via the online feedback system till 15th Jan.

topic.description: Introduction and requirements principles (Introduction; Principles of good requirements engineering)
Requirements techniques (Requirements Elicitation and Modelling; Use of Natural Language; Requirements reuse;)
Requirements management and Introduction to Architecture (Requirements validation; Requirements management; Introduction to Architecture based development)
Architectural techniques (Principles of architecture design and descriptions; Representation of architectures; Architectures for reuse)
Architectural assessment (Architecture evaluation; Architectures and safety; Mapping architectures to requirements and implementation)

material.materialName: Copies of all lecture slides, case studies and exercises will be provided.

book.bookName: Requirements Engineering: From System Goals to UML Models to Software Specifications
